Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Internal Auditor - Data Analyst New Joiners
Description:
The Risk Assurance Services area of PwC is dedicated to the analysis and management of business risks, helping organizations strengthen their governance, optimize processes, and comply with regulations. Its objective is to provide security and confidence to stakeholders through audits, evaluation of internal controls, and the use of technology to minimize risks.

In this team, you will deal with complex business challenges and outline strategies for our clients in Portugal and internationally, using technology and data analysis to increase security and optimize the efficiency of companies' processes.

Integrated into the Risk Assurance team, the professional to be hired will have the following main responsibilities:


Conduct internal audits and risk assessments for clients from different sectors
Analyze and optimize processes, ensuring compliance with regulations and best practices
Support the implementation and improvement of internal control systems and corporate governance
Work with data analysis and technology tools to enhance the effectiveness of audit processes
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop customized solutions for clients


Curious?

Can you already imagine being part of our Community?

Requirements

If you are convinced that this opportunity is for you, then you just need to make sure you meet the following requirements - take a look:


Bachelor's and/or master's degree in Management, Economics, Finance, or similar areas
Interest in Internal Audit, Internal Control, Data Analysis, and process optimization
Analytical skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking
Dynamism and strong team spirit
Capacity for learning
Responsible and resilient
Fluency in Portuguese (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of English (spoken and written)


If, like us, you believe that the success of PwC lies in the essence of People and their authenticity, dynamism, and willingness to go "beyond," then‚Ä¶ you have found your "world".

It's time to apply - we want you to be part of the "Team PwC"!

Title: Data Analyst - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Analyst, you will build analyses and participate in the development of projects that help make strategic decisions for the function (e.g. Analyzing workforce trends for the general management).

Your Main Activities Are

In This Role, Your Missions Will Include

Understand the needs expressed by senior management, HR teams, or the business.

Translate them into an analytical roadmap (scope of analysis, metrics...) to help make decisions.

Develop dashboards (Power BI and Tableau) and written analyses (preparation, exploration, descriptive analysis, data visualization, clustering, machine learning, NLP...) in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers of the team.

Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of workforce trends, from data collection to the delivery of analyses to senior management.

Clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner‚Ä¶), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have experience as an analyst, management controller, auditor, consultant in a quantitative-oriented position.

Pedagogically, you can communicate your statistical analyses and results clearly and intelligibly to different stakeholders, both in writing and orally, adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors.

You have significant experience in data visualization, data preparation and machine-learning.

Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of Human Resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data Quality and Security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical Skills (Expert)

Project Management Skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and trainings (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication Skills ‚Äì oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving Skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

Python (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Mobility is one of the core principles of BNP Paribas career and management strategy, which aims to meet our Employees‚Äô needs for personal development along with ensuring that the company meets the overall business needs. For further details, we invite you to explore the mobility principles available on https://bwelcome.hr.bnpparibas/internalmobility. Before applying, please make sure you discuss it with your manager whose support is critical

Title: Data Analyst - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As a RISK Reporting Data Analyst, you will be responsible for producing BCEF‚Äôs RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in cooperation with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also contribute to the production of credit risk reporting and indicators to address increasing regulatory demands and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank‚Äôs credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines ‚Äì LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


During monthly and quarterly financial closings
Production of controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall) to critically assess the elements used in capital calculation
Identification of potential anomalies during the capital run and making necessary corrections
Production of dashboards to explain RWA amounts and their variations
Analysis and explanation of results from both an internal and standard approach (following the implementation of Basel 4 in January 2025), including the preparation of presentation materials
Post-financial closings, you will lead work to optimize BCEF‚Äôs RWA
Analyze and track the impact of compensations (RISK/Finance discrepancies) to reduce them in collaboration with the Finance teams in Madrid
Analyze risk parameters (freshness of ratings and RTS36 impacts, limiting risk parameters for defaulted items or those subject to management rules)
Contribute to improving the quality of data used (e.g., analyzing collateral, tracking remediation actions on data quality controls (Defensive and RDI controls), participating in the Data Quality Committee (COMET))
Finally, you will also contribute to the production of risk reporting and indicators
Produce and analyze credit risk indicators for recharges or new securitization vehicles to meet internal and regulatory requirements (including the future SLA between RISK BCEF and ALMT)
Produce regular regulatory reports (e.g., Short Term Exercise, Loan Tape CRE) or ad-hoc reports (e.g., BCE requests) in cooperation with the Paris reporting teams

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Tableau
Power BI
SQL
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to manage a project
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


2/3 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Customer Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Ready to lead, disrupt and reinvent the sleep industry?

We are Emma ‚Äì The Sleep Company. Founded in 2015, we‚Äôve become the world‚Äôs largest D2C sleep brand, available in over 35 countries with more than 25 stores across Europe. Recommended by leading consumer associations in EMEA, APAC, and the Americas, we develop the best sleep comfort products that empower our customers to awaken their best every day.

At Emma, we are a community of smart, driven people, united by a strong culture of collaboration, teamwork, and knowledge sharing. We think big, take ownership, and are empowered to drive meaningful impact. Through hands-on experience, mentorship, and continuous learning, we drive our own growth and learning. With Emmies from over 60 nationalities and offices across multiple regions, our diverse perspectives enrich our workplace culture. Ready to shape the future of sleep with us? Let‚Äôs make it happen!

What You'll Do


Transform Customer Data into Action: Analyze customer journey data to generate actionable insights that improve customer experience (CSAT, NPS, contact rate).
Develop Reporting Solutions: Own the design, development, and maintenance of dashboards and reports for the Customer Excellence team.
Data-Driven Decision Support: Translate customer experience challenges into analytical approaches, identifying opportunities for improvement in processes and support.
Own CX Reporting: Manage the entire reporting process, ensuring consistent, reliable, and timely delivery of insights to stakeholders.
Create Impactful Visualizations: Build intuitive and effective dashboards in Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with Customer Service, Product Tech, and Operations teams to ensure insights align with business goals and improve the overall customer journey.
Improve Data Infrastructure: Contribute to data modeling and the optimization of ETL pipelines specific to Customer Excellence needs.



Who We Are Looking For


Experience: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in customer experience or support contexts.
SQL Expertise: Proficient in SQL (Redshift, Oracle, or similar databases).
Customer Metrics Knowledge: Strong understanding of Customer Experience metrics (CSAT, NPS, CES, etc.).
Data Visualization Skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Quicksight.
Autonomous Analyst: Ability to manage end-to-end data processes with minimal supervision.
ETL & Data Modeling: Experience with data modeling and building ETL pipelines.
Python for Data: Python scripting experience for data manipulation is a plus.
Statistical Tools: Familiarity with R, SAS, or Matlab is valued.
Proactive & Solution-Oriented: Strong problem-solving mindset with the ability to turn complex data into clear insights.



What We Offer


Pet-friendly environment, where you can bring your furry desk buddy;
Discounts on our top-notch products;
Health insurance including dentist;
24 days holidays / year +1 day/year at Emma (m√°x. 29 days);
The opportunity to collaborate with multinational teams;
Exciting events that aren't just team-building exercises but opportunities to create epic memories;
All the tools you need to grow and ownership from the beginning.



Become an Emmie

Emma is transforming the world of sleep - and we want the highest-performing people to help us pull it off. We want you. But only if you're willing to go all in. Only if you're willing to question, disrupt, innovate, and create from the ground up.

We proudly celebrate diversity. We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting inclusion in our workplace. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, ethnic origin, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.

Our aim is to get back to you in a couple of days, however, we are currently receiving a large number of applications and this might lead to a delay in the process. We will get back to you as soon as possible!

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Main tasks:


Analyses, plans, implements and technically tests IT solutions in the context of projects within the scope of the DataWarehouse.
Ensures the formalization and ensures that documentation is completed in accordance with current procedures.
Occasionally participates in meetings with the Business Areas and in working sessions with the team responsible for functional definition, carrying out certification/quality tests and monitoring UAT tests.
Proposes improvements to management platforms and tools, with the aim of optimizing and innovating them.
Formalize and documents the technical analyses it carries out, the technical solutions it implements, the technical tests it performs and the decision-making meetings it participates in.
Communicates and validates its activities and decisions with the person in charge, thus ensuring that they are aligned with the department's recommendations in terms of posture and Roadmap.
Reports to the Data Hub Chapter.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Knowledge of programming Microsoft BI Tolls
SQL/T-SQL
Power Bi
Jira/Confluence/ Draw IO
Knowledge of applications from a user perspective: MS Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or similar areas.
Experience in Datawarehouse solutions, with an understanding of all phases of construction.
Minimum of 6 years of experience in functional/technical analysis and definition of corporate data models.
Analytical skills and clear skills for conceptual designs that respond transversally to the Datawarehouse.
Experience in projects/environments with Agile framework.
Preference for experience in models with Data Vault methodology.
Preference for experience in the Banking area (consumer credit)

Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Main tasks:

  • Analyses, plans, implements and technically tests IT solutions in the context of projects within the scope of the DataWarehouse.
  • Ensures the formalization and ensures that documentation is completed in accordance with current procedures.
  • Occasionally participates in meetings with the Business Areas and in working sessions with the team responsible for functional definition, carrying out certification/quality tests and monitoring UAT tests.
  • Proposes improvements to management platforms and tools, with the aim of optimizing and innovating them.
  • Formalize and documents the technical analyses it carries out, the technical solutions it implements, the technical tests it performs and the decision-making meetings it participates in.
  • Communicates and validates its activities and decisions with the person in charge, thus ensuring that they are aligned with the department's recommendations in terms of posture and Roadmap.
  • Reports to the Data Hub Chapter.

Qualifications

Technical Skills:

  • Knowledge of programming Microsoft BI Tolls
  • SQL/T-SQL
  • Power Bi
  • Jira/Confluence/ Draw IO
  • Knowledge of applications from a user perspective: MS Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or similar areas.
  • Experience in Datawarehouse solutions, with an understanding of all phases of construction.
  • Minimum of 6 years of experience in functional/technical analysis and definition of corporate data models.
  • Analytical skills and clear skills for conceptual designs that respond transversally to the Datawarehouse.
  • Experience in projects/environments with Agile framework.
  • Preference for experience in models with Data Vault methodology.
  • Preference for experience in the Banking area (consumer credit)

Language Skills

  • Portuguese
  • English

Additional Information

Soft skills:

Strong communication and organizational skills

Ability to gather requirements, document and lead meetings

Autonomy and proactivity. Critical thinking

Ability to synthesize and solve problems. Adaptability and resilience

Focus on the customer and delivering results

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gamdom is home to thousands of betting options for both sports and casino players to wager on. Since 2016, we have been steadily growing to provide more than just casino games and sports betting events to enjoy; With us, you can enjoy unique bonuses and earn massive rewards simultaneously. Discover all the rewarding features Gamdom can offer you below.

Gamdom is seeking a Data Analyst with strong technical skills to join our fast-paced data team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of analytics, engineering, and visualization. You'll bring hands-on experience in SQL, Snowflake, and dbt, along with business-facing skills in reporting, dashboard development (using Tableau), and data analysis to drive insights across the company.

The successful candidate will analyze existing reporting logic, collaborate with data engineers to design robust data models and data marts, and build scalable, high-impact Tableau dashboards. You will also support the transition of reports and dashboards to our new Snowflake environment and provide actionable insights to stakeholders across finance, CRM, marketing, and operations.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is independent, proactive, and adaptable‚Äîcomfortable managing their workload, collaborating across teams, and driving solutions forward with minimal supervision. The ideal candidate is passionate about analytics, confident in SQL and data modeling, and experienced in working alongside engineers and analysts to translate business needs into technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze SQL queries in Tableau and Snowflake datasets to extract key KPIs, metrics, and business logic.
Collaborate with data engineers to build robust reporting data models and data marts in Snowflake.
Act as a bridge between stakeholders and data engineering‚Äîgathering requirements, clarifying business definitions, and ensuring accurate metric implementation.
Design, develop, and optimize Tableau dashboards aligned with business needs and performance standards.
Support the migration of reports and dashboards to the new Snowflake environment.
Conduct data analysis to generate actionable insights for finance, CRM, marketing, and operations teams.
Clearly communicate new data models and metrics to BI and data analysts to ensure adoption and consistency.
Provide support for ad hoc data analyses, reporting requests, and broader data initiatives.
Contribute to data governance by documenting definitions, processes, and ensuring consistency across the organization.
Assist in advanced analytics initiatives, such as fraud detection, customer segmentation, churn analysis, and performance tracking.


Required Skills & Competencies


2‚Äì4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within the casino, iGaming, or online entertainment industry.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience with Snowflake and dbt (or similar tools) for data modeling and ETL.
Proficiency in Tableau or similar BI tools (e.g., Power BI), including dashboard design and optimization.
Solid understanding of SQL-based data modeling, warehousing principles, and KPI frameworks.
Ability to work independently, manage competing priorities, and proactively solve problems.
Strong analytical mindset with excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with tools like Jira for backlog and task management (a plus).
Understanding of data privacy considerations in analytics.
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field (preferred).


Why Join Us


Work with a talented, collaborative team on meaningful, high-impact projects.
Help shape the future of analytics in a fast-growing, innovative company.
Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge cloud data platforms and tools.
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and strong opportunities for professional growth.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for a Data Governance Analyst. The ideal candidate embodies technical prowess in RISK Systems by defining and embedding data governance policies, procedures, and standards, coupled with a fervent commitment to making every piece of data matter. We value individuals who are detail-oriented, independent contributors with exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, ensuring that together, we continue to transform possibilities into reality.

This position is Hybrid/on-site in Lisbon and it is for a 7-month project.

Note: All applications/CV‚Äôs must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Implement and promote data governance best practices across the RISK Systems landscape
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including data definitions, standards, metrics, and methodologies
Collaborate on the development and enhancement of data governance tools
Contribute to the review and enhancement of existing critical data assets
Monitor data governance performance and report on adherence to defined standards
Support the management of data quality committees and related governance forums
Assist in developing strategies for managing the full lifecycle of data
Ensure teams understand and follow established data governance principles


Requirements For The Role


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Risk Management, IT, or a related discipline
At least 3 years of experience in a data-related or risk management role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to produce clear, concise, and high-quality documentation
Strong interpersonal skills; capable of working across global teams
Self-starter with a delivery-focused mindset and strong organisational skills
Practical experience with data validation, loading, and quality assurance processes
Familiarity with market and counterparty risk concepts is a plus
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of ‚Ç¨8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration ‚Äì Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Pleo, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We‚Äôre creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation ‚Äì which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you‚Äôll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

We're searching for a talented and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team. You‚Äôll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your insights will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What You Will Be Doing

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:


Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Gain a deep understanding of our customers needs and experiences to identify opportunities to improve customer experience CX
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Supporting our data governance initiatives, aligning measurement and metrics across business areas domains
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What You Bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Senior Data Analyst with a strong product analytics background, ideally in a fintech/SaaS company
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have deep experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML, and product analytics tools such as Amplitude
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Have strong statistical knowledge, with experience in experimentation at scale
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Harness your understanding of business and product strategy, to provide actionable, insightful recommendations
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail.


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office üçú
Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or M√©dis
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work üë∂


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‚Äòmore than you‚Äôd expect‚Äô, and it‚Äôs been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it‚Äôs only fitting that we‚Äôd pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn‚Äôt be siloed from the rest of the organisation ‚Äì they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‚Äòchampion the customer‚Äô, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‚Äòsucceed as a team‚Äô, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‚Äòmake it happen‚Äô by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‚Äòbuild to scale‚Äô, creating lasting solutions that address today‚Äôs challenges and anticipate tomorrow‚Äôs needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices ‚Äîand quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it‚Äôs our company language so you‚Äôll be speaking lots of it if you join üíï
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone üòä
We‚Äôre on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That‚Äôs only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We seek a Business Intelligence Consultant willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa - must live in Portugal - mandatory).

Are you the one?


Design data schemas, modeling data structures and perform data migrations.

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Arabic Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


Job Information

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.

We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Join Us at Closer Consulting!

Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation ‚Äì we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home. We provide our people with the means, opportunities, and support they need to thrive and innovate. ‚ú®

For this position, it is necessary to have a residence in Lisbon, PT.

We seek a Data Analyst professional who is willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid project.

What You'll Be Doing


Design and maintain business dashboards and impactful data visualizations
Analyze large and complex datasets to support strategic and operational decisions
Build and optimize data pipelines using Airflow, SQL, and Python
Ensure data quality and consistency across referential sources ‚úÖ
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand needs and deliver insights
Support continuous improvement of data processes and analytical tools
Work in Agile teams and contribute to the evolution of third-party data ecosystems ‚öôÔ∏è‚òÅÔ∏è


What We're Looking For


6+ years of experience in data analysis, functional/technical specification, and data modeling
Advanced skills in SQL, Python, and PySpark
Experience with Oracle databases (SQL Server/PostgreSQL is a plus)
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, or other visualization tools
Familiarity with Airflow for pipeline orchestration ‚è±Ô∏è
Experience in Data Warehousing and file formats like Parquet
Ability to work with APIs and knowledge of Git is a plus
Solid grasp of Agile methodologies (SCRUM)


Soft Skills That Matter


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management Ô∏è
Proactivity, autonomy, and adaptability
Attention to detail and ability to synthesize information
Team spirit and client orientation


Languages

English ‚Äì Fluent (preferred)

French ‚Äì Intermediate (nice to have)

Portuguese ‚Äì Fluent (mandatory)

Nice To Have


Knowledge of referential data and banking domain (consumer credit)
Tools like Jira, Confluence, and Draw.IO for documentation and collaboration


We Believe We Are The Ones To


Providing a multidisciplinary Team
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth
Providing you with a custom training plan
Helping you reach happiness


Oh‚Ä¶ And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects
Stimulating teams and leaders
World-class Clients and Partners


If you enjoy turning data into business-driving decisions, we'd like to talk to you. Send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and discover the closer side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst (Python & Oracle)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst (Python & Oracle) for an international project.

üí° What We're Looking For


2+ years of relevant experience in technical roles;
Proficient in Python;
Proven experience with SQL and relational database management (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL);
Profiency with PySpark and Apache Airflow;
Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban);
Fluency in English (written and spoken).


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject "DAPO/IB/DB‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Senior Analyst - Protective Intelligence
Description:
Job Description

The Position

The Protective Intelligence function as part of Organon Security and Resilience (OSR) organization, supports corporate security programs in collaboration with the OSR CoEs and Regional teams. The function is responsible for the Organon Security & Resilience Center with 24/7 coverage.

We are currently recruiting for a Senior Analyst - Protective Intelligence. This role will support the Insider Risk program, Strategic Intelligence program, Travel Risk Management program and All-hazard threat intelligence monitoring (such as natural disasters, security incidents, geopolitical situations) and collection in order to proactively inform on and mitigate risks that could impact business operations, facilities and personnel.

This role will report to the Associate Director of Protective Intelligence, who oversees a team of analysts who monitor intelligence feeds and open-source channels, assess potential impact, and report to stakeholders in a timely manner. The team also services the company‚Äôs 24/7 crisis management contact point, triaging to the appropriate Security & Resilience leaders to provide business critical support during incidents.

Responsibilities


Participates as a team member to ensure coverage of 24/7 emergency telephone line that escalates external and internal events that have the potential to negatively impact Organon employees, facilities, operations, cause physical or environmental damage, or threaten financial standing, reputation, or property.
Conducts proactive reviews to determine if threats exist to Organon Executives, travelers or events.
Alert Security & Resilience members about threats to Organon.
Manage tools and technologies that ensure founders‚Äô wellbeing and support Country Incident Management Teams, Corporate Incident Assessment Team and Corporate Crisis Management Team, as warranted.
Report Cyber Security Incidents and Product Integrity incidents.
Provide strategic analysis of threat events to senior managers.
Provide tactical assessments and support.
Data scraping in open source and vendors to identify security deteriorations and trends.
Drive best practices and provide guidance.
Includes shift work (after hours, weekends and holidays).


Education Minimum Requirement

Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required -

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in in Security Studies, Political Science, International Relations or related field.

Required Experience And Skills


3 - 4 years‚Äô relevant experience in a security operations center, or similar environment with analytical, investigative, emergency response, security or geopolitical assessment experience
Expertise in multi-source intelligence collection, assessment and dissemination.
Knowledge of the intelligence cycle, including analytic methodologies and techniques.
Strong oral and written communication skills, especially in preparing clear and concise summaries of critical events in a timely manner.
Excellent attention to detail.
Demonstrated experience synthesizing large amounts of information from multiple sources into concise, analytic assessments.
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive information.
Action oriented with a passion for getting things done quickly, efficiently, and properly.
Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual and stressful circumstances
English language fluency
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite to include Teams.


Others


Advanced degree and / or relevant certifications is a plus
Other languages a plus.


Secondary Job Description

Who We Are:

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women‚Äôs Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from candidates with a diverse background. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our applicants.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Organon LLC, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Annualized Salary Range

Annualized Salary Range (Global)

Annualized Salary Range (Canada)

Please Note: Pay ranges are specific to local market and therefore vary from country to country.

Employee Status

Regular

Relocation:

No relocation

VISA Sponsorship

Travel Requirements: Organon employees must be able to satisfy all applicable travel and credentialing requirements, including associated vaccination prerequisites

Shift

Flexible Work Arrangements:

Valid Driving License

Hazardous Material(s):

Number Of Openings

1

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day


As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Ensure high quality of delivery
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Create/Update some dashboards
Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team based in Lisbon and Porto. Our working language is English, and we offer a hybrid work model
You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has three mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges
The team is young, agile, and everyone is growing together. More than 20 colleagues are working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences, and you will be able to share your insights with the central teams in Paris
We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?

Do you have‚Ä¶


A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field?
At least 3 years of relevant experience
Strong programming skills in Python?
Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
Fluency in oral and written English.
Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau Software)
Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
Availability for occasional travel in Europe


If you bring all this, a lot of desire, energy and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for...

We look forward to receiving your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more
HTML:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day

  • As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
    • Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
    • Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
    • Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
    • Ensure high quality of delivery
    • Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
    • Create/Update some dashboards
    • Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
    • Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!

What do we have to offer you?

  • This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.

Are you the one we are looking for?

Do you have‚Ä¶

  • A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field?
  • At least 3 years of relevant experience
  • Strong programming skills in Python?
  • Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
  • Fluency in oral and written English.
  • Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
  • Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau Software)
  • Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
  • Availability for occasional travel in Europe

If you bring all this, a lot of desire, energy and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for...

We look forward to receiving your application!
