Title: Data Governance Analyst
HTML:
WIRE IT was born during the pandemic period and is proudly based in Portugal. Our values are built around today's IT reality: flexibility, transparency, trust, freedom, digital mindset, and the creation of Focused Partnerships making a real difference through trusted relationships with our collaborators and clients.

We are an IT services company operating worldwide, driven by an experienced and senior team that helps clients make the right decisions in a fast-moving market.

If you're looking for more than just a job - if you're looking for a place where you can truly make a difference - you might be the next person to join WIRE IT.

Role: Data Governance Analyst.

Location: Hybrid, Lisbon.

Required Skills

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
  • Min. 2 years of experience as a Data Governance Analyst;
  • Experience implementing data governance best practices;
  • Experience in preparing and updating key documentation;
  • Experience in Data or Risk related businesses;
  • Experience producing high quality documentations;
  • Experience in direct communication with stakeholders;
  • Responsible and proactive;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team;
  • Organized professional with attention to details;
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (spoken and written).

We Offer

  • No-term full-time contract;
  • Health Insurance;
  • 22 days of paid vacation;
  • 4 extra days annually (Carnival, Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, Birthday);
  • Meal Allowance on card (Coverflex);
  • Referral Bonus;
  • Special discounts and flex options;
  • Training annual budget;
  • A great team-oriented culture;
  • Chance to become a part of a dynamically growing international company;
  • Challenging projects giving the unique opportunity to grow and learn.

Following the EU General Data Protection Regulation No. 2016/679, we inform you that by responding to this announcement, you consent to the use of your data by Wire IT, for as long as necessary. In case of doubt or request for elimination of your personal data, please send an email to info@wireit.pt.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.

Your main activies are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders.


Behavioral Skills

Profile and skills to success


Ability to synthetize/simplify: Expert
Communication skills - oral & written: Expert
Ability to deliver/Results driven: Expert


Transversal Skills


Analytical Ability: Expert
Ability to manage a project: Proficient


Business Skills


Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics - Business Analytics: Expert


Languages


English (Fluent)


Tools and Methodologies


DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Expert)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT MICROSOFT SQL Server (Expert)


Experience, Academic Background & Other Qualifications

Field of Expertise


Data Analytics ([3 - 4] years)


Academic Background


Masters in Mathematics and Statistics
Masters in Information Technology and Computer Science


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Visualization (Looker)
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We seek a Data Visualization willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa/ Carnaxide - must live in Portugal - mandatory).

Are you the one?


2/3+ years of experience in Data roles (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, etc.);
Advanced knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and transformation;
Experience with Power BI and/or Looker (LookML);
Solid understanding of ETL, data pipelines, cleaning, and modeling;
English proficiency at B1 level or higher (comfortable with technical reading and basic communication).


We Believe We Are The Ones To, By


Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.


Oh‚Ä¶ And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to joana.ferreira@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We are seeking a skilled Business Intelligence Consultant (5+ years of professional experience) eager to take on new challenges in a hybrid work model in Lisbon (4 days in the office).

Are you the one?

  • SQL language for extracting and manipulating data in different databases;
  • Power BI tool for creating reports, dashboards and data visualizations.
  • Other relevant technologies, such as Python, machine learning, are optional;
  • Agile methodologies and data project life cycle.
  • Analytical and critical thinking to identify patterns and insights in data;
  • Ability to communicate complex results clearly and concisely to different audiences;
  • Proactivity and willingness to learn new technologies and tools.
  • Opportunity to work in a collaborative and innovative environment;
  • Challenging projects with a direct impact on business;
  • Continuous professional development.

We Believe We Are The Ones To, By

  • Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
  • Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
  • Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
  • Providing you with a custom training plan.
  • Helping you reach happiness.

Oh‚Ä¶ And By The Way, We Also Have

  • Several challenging complex projects.
  • Stimulating teams and leaders.
  • World-class Clients and Partners.

If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to catarina.rolo@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst - Operational and Permanent Control Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The OPC analyst plays a key role in Global Banking CCCO(Chief Conduct and Control Officer) Office Front-to-Ops missions and worldwide mandate to identify and assess non-financial risks, to ensure the enforcement and efficiency of the control framework and to promote an adequate risk management culture. The Analyst contributes to Global Banking CCCO leading the Front-to-Operations to IT alignment for Global Banking across the three regions to strengthen and industrialize GB non-financial risk management set-up, anticipate regulators' expectations and protect the interests of the Bank' stakeholders.

Specifically, the OPC(Operational and Permanent Control) Analyst operates the Control framework relating to all operational risks, including Fraud, Third Party, Conduct, Compliance, Regulatory, Information & Communication Technology risks, and others risks types.

Your Main Activities Are


Performing/driving the risk identification and assessment in liaison with independent control Functions when needed
Ensuring validation by the relevant management level and consistency with the defined risk tolerance.
Contributing to the definition and follow-up of remediation plan if needed
Centralize and automate the production of reports gathering major operational risks indicators via automated KPI/KRI dashboards
Automate, when possible and relevant, sampling creation, control execution, and control reporting across the full value chain
Manage Procedures by ensuring that Group procedures requirements are implemented locally, complemented with local specificities
Ensure that the procedures designed by the businesses and functions are identified, updated, properly stored and communicated to the relevant stakeholders within the Operating Entity
Identify and propose calibration of procedures according to the outcome of the risk assessment and other risk events
Perform and/or coordinate controls according to this control plan
Ensure that control results are reviewed and analyzed by the Management and when relevant by operational teams / relevant stakeholders and that remediation action plans are defined if and when needed
Input in Group tools the control results and major action plans. Follow-up the implementation of remediation actions
Collect incidents, report and update in the incidents database, including suspected and attempted fraud cases
Analyze incidents in a timely manner and define, jointly with the relevant stakeholders, the correctives measures be implemented to mitigate risks
Follow-up and /or initiate the implementation of remediation actions and the unfolding of long-term incidents.
Perform controls on the incident collection process, particularly the cross-check with other databases and the half-yearly attestation by the local management.
Alert and escalate to the relevant level of management any operational risk incident and any recurring weakness.
Perform periodic and ad-hoc reporting to the appropriate level of management as well as to independent control functions
Ensure an appropriate training on Operational risks and Permanent Control framework is provided to employees, notably newcomers
Show ability to take ownership of specific OPC activity streams/topics and be able to deliver the full and exhaustive actions taken on the assigned processes to the management.


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, Finance or any similar areas
Advanced level of english fluency, both oral and written
Up to 2 years of experience in data analytics, operational risk or compliance activities
Experience using Microsoft Office Tools, particularly Excel
Proficiency in Power BI, Python and SQL
Attention to detail and creative thinking


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group's retail activities and specialized business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialized businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit [1] https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Quality Analyst - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Quality Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing and improving data quality within the organization. You will be responsible for implementing data quality control processes, identifying anomalies, proposing solutions to ensure data integrity and reliability and building HR activity monitoring dashboards.

Your Main Activities Are


Understanding the data quality needs expressed by various HR teams and the Data Analysts of the team;
Developing and implementing data quality strategies to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability;
Conducting regular data audits to identify errors and inconsistencies;
Documenting data quality processes and training teams on best practices;
Clearly and concisely communicating data quality analysis results and recommendations to stakeholders;
Developing and updating monitoring or activity management dashboards (Power BI and Tableau).


Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have significant experience as a data analyst, management controller, auditor, or consultant in a data quality-oriented position;

You hold excellent ability to analyze and interpret complex data;

You are a good communicator and can clearly and intelligibly convey your analyses and results to various stakeholders;

You have solid experience in data visualization and data preparation;

Finally, we place particular importance on our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Product Owner) and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of human resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data quality and security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical skills (Expert)

Project management skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and training (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication skills ‚Äì oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

  • Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)

#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: Quant Research AI
Description:
Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with our GM Data and AI Lab teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions for various projects
Conduct independent research to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technology within the Markets 360 investment research domain
Contribute to the development of systematic and industrialized AI solutions to enhance investment strategies
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of AI technologies into our existing infrastructure
Stay updated on the latest AI advancements and industry trends to continuously improve our Markets 360 research efforts


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in a numeric subject with understanding of economics and markets (eg.: Economics with a speciality in Econometrics, Finance, Computer Science, Applied Maths, Engineering, Physics)
Knowledge of key concepts in Statistics and Mathematics such as Probability Theory, Inference, and Linear Algebra
Programming skills‚ÄØin Python‚ÄØand knowledge of common numerical and machine-learning packages (NumPy,‚ÄØscikit-learn, pandas,‚ÄØKeras, TensorFlow,‚ÄØPyTorch)
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing AI solutions, with a focus on large language models and natural language processing
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to manage projects efficiently, including planning, execution, and monitoring
Understanding of the financial industry and investment research, including relevant regulations and compliance requirements


About The Team

Markets 360 is made up of around 100 economists, strategists and analysts across the Americas, Western Europe, CEEMEA and Asia Pacific, who work closely together to create cross-asset perspectives.

With a focus on value-added research and thought leadership, the aim is to publish clear, timely and thought-provoking pieces on topics ranging from financial and economic forecasts to in-depth analysis of particular assets, economies and themes.

The GM Data and AI Lab team is a small team of data scientists applying the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Data modelling and Natural Language Processing to strategic projects for the business.

This role will be in Portugal, working alongside the AI Lab and the Markets 360 teams based across the globe.

About Global Markets

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutional, corporate, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶)

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Portuguese: Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


Job Information

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.

We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities

  • SOP Clarification and Training:
  • Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
  • Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
  • Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
  • Quality Improvement and Assurance:
  • Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
  • Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
  • Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
  • Project Management:
  • Ensure timely delivery of projects
  • Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
  • Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
  • 1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
  • Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
  • Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
  • Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
  • Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language

Job Information

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.

We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: OPC Reporting and Automation - Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:


Regulatory Practice: support any regulatory requirement with a sustainable framework, in line with the dedicated Governance, Control Plan & Risk Assessment
Conduct Practice: assess and challenge the effectiveness of the Conduct control set-up as well as ensure a full convergence between Conduct Risk Identification (CRI), Risk and Control Self-Assessment ‚Äì RCSA).
Operational Risk Practice: contribute to protect the business (P&L, reputation)


The three Practices are further supported by three transversal Streams ‚Äì Protection (Management and monitoring of incidents, remediation actions and recommendations), Prevention (Deploying RCSA and contribute to Operational risk computation) and Supervision (Validation process and Coordinating the internal control Governance and other Regulatory-based committees).

Your Main Activities Are


Support the team to produce regular reporting on the main operational risk indicators, and proactively suggest improvements on the reports;
Use different tools to collect and analyze data, as well as structuring queries and performing routine maintenance of reports;
Perform trend analysis comparison to previous weeks/months/quarters
Proactively suggest improvements on reports on a continuous basis and promote digital solutions
Ensure data input & quality check;
Support the execution of governance committees and presentations
Support the OPC team with Ad-Hoc requests (Statistics; Kpis; presentations; etc.)
Liaise & Interact with OPC teams worldwide


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor, Post-Graduation or Master Degree in Data Science; Management, Finance, Science, Maths;
Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, VBA, Power BI, (other languages would be a plus)
Analytical and quantitative skills, Precision, rigorousness;
Excellent organizational skills
Team spirit, ability to work with others;
Ability to communicate clearly in both oral and written form (English);
Experience in investment banking is an advantage.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: +4 years

Location : Lisbon/Porto




Skills Needed?




Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related fields.
Proven experience in data analysis and Power BI.
Proficiency in SQL and other data manipulation tools.
Ability to create interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good communication skills to present insights clearly and effectively.
Ability to work independently and in a team.
The candidate has to be in Portugal.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
About CARMA

CARMA is the world's most advanced research and intelligence company, specializing in comprehensive media monitoring and analysis services. We combine cutting-edge technology with extensive data collection to deliver actionable insights and customized media solutions.

¬∑ Our proprietary crawler processes millions of global content pieces every day in over 100 languages, across all types of media.

¬∑ Through our strategic, hands-on approach, we help brands maintain a strong global presence and sustain their market position in the ever-evolving PR and media landscape.




About the Role:

At CARMA, we are looking for an experienced Insights Analyst to Analyze media coverage from company monitoring platforms to derive actionable intelligence for clients. Take ownership of the final report quality, ensuring that high standards are met. Continuously enhance the reporting process and overall efficiency to support company objectives and client requirements.




Analysis and Reporting:

Report Ownership: Take full ownership of the final quality of reports, ensuring they meet client standards and expectations.
Media Content Analysis: Analyze media content to extract meaningful insights that support clients' business goals.
High-Quality Reporting: Produce high-quality client reports, both qualitative and quantitative, within tight deadlines. Include tables, charts, summaries, and narratives to clearly present findings.
Ongoing Report Enhancement: seeking feedback from senior insight managers and operational insight managers to improve the reports and team members to continuously improve the reporting process.
Ongoing Process Enhancement: Continuously work on enhancing the reporting process to improve efficiency and profitability.

Additional Duties:

Policy Adherence: Comply with CARMA policies and procedures, supporting the company's mission and vision.
Additional Duties: Perform other job-related tasks as assigned by the direct manager.




Education

BA in Journalism, Business Analytics, Communication, Advertising, Marketing, Public Relations or any related field.




Experience

1 year of experience in an analytical role (including data analysis, market research) within marketing research, media intelligence and data technology, or consulting firm is preferred.

1 year of Market research, data analytics or exposure to traditional and social media is preferred.

Familiar with data visualization and dashboard tools, Microsoft Excel, pivot tables, etc.

Experience in both qualitative and quantitative reporting is preferred.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
üìå We‚Äôre Hiring: Data Quality Analyst | Lisbon (Hybrid)




Are you passionate about data integrity and eager to make a real impact in one of Europe‚Äôs leading financial institutions? Join our Data Quality & Governance team as a Data Quality Analyst, and play a key role in maintaining and enhancing the accuracy of critical financial data.




üîç About the role

As a Data Quality Analyst, you‚Äôll ensure the successful execution of our global data quality remediation plan. You‚Äôll support both central and local teams in identifying data issues, assessing their impact, and driving resolution actions. From daily support to strategic project contribution, you‚Äôll be a key player in maintaining robust data governance and reporting standards.




üéØ What you‚Äôll do

Support data issue logging with complete descriptions, impact analysis, and format compliance
Help identify risks associated with data anomalies
Collaborate with Head Office and local teams to resolve issues
Monitor action plans, define priorities, and ensure timely remediation
Provide daily support during financial closings and help improve related procedures
Prepare and coordinate meetings across EMEA teams on data quality topics
Contribute to data quality reports and share updates with governance committees
Act as the main point of contact for data quality within evolution and transformation projects
Support and escalate progress, blockers, and data quality KPIs to R&F DO and GDO teams




üíº What we're looking for:

üîß Technical Skills

Strong analytical skills and results-driven mindset
Knowledge of the banking industry, with experience in accounting, credit, and COREP reporting
Proficiency in Dataiku and Power BI (Expert level)
Solid understanding of data quality principles and governance practices




üåê Language Skills

Fluent English (spoken and written ‚Äì mandatory)




üí° Soft Skills

Strong team player with excellent collaboration skills
Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written
Proactive, organized, and capable of managing multiple priorities
Comfortable working with international teams across various locations




üöÄ Sounds like your kind of challenge? Let‚Äôs talk! Apply now and take the next step in your career.

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
Randstad Digital is hiring a Technical Expert in Data Analytics to join a leading company based in Lisbon.




Responsibilities:

Skywise (Data Analytics Platform): Play a central role in maintaining and enhancing our data analytics and reporting infrastructure within Skywise. You will be responsible for supporting existing reports and developing new components to meet evolving business needs.

QlikSense (Dashboard & KPI Monitoring): Oversee the Reward Operations dashboard, ensuring its ongoing functionality and relevance. You will lead all initiatives related to the dashboard‚Äôs evolution, including enhancements and optimizations.

Escriba (SAP Document Management): Manage and implement updates to our contract documentation processes through Escriba. You will ensure this essential component remains aligned with business and legal requirements.







Skills:

Fluent level of English
Bachelor degree in Information Systems Technology or Data Analytics. (Master degree preferred)
Python knowledge including library like Pandas / Numpy mandatory
Skywise Palantir knowledge mandatory
Qliksense & Escriba knowledge is a plus
SAP HR knowledge is a plus




Offer:

Atractive salary package with benefits
Direct contract with the final client
Integration in a leading company with a multicultural environment
The opportunity to grow your skills and capabilities and career opportunities across the globe
A hybrid working model

Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!


At InnoTech, it‚Äôs all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.


For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!


Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.


Your Mission Will Be:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders from different sectors to identify and understand their specific analytical needs and challenges;
  • Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for improvement and customization;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights;
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need:

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in data analysis;
  • Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have:

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
  • Experience in query languages such as SQL;
  • Familiarity with business intelligence principles and data management practices.


With Us You Can Be a:

  • TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
  • TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
  • InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
  • InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Driven | Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description


At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description


Are you passionate about data analysis and visualization? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data-Driven Intelligence team.

Creation of reports/dashboards where information is easily available to users for direct consumption and presented in a user-friendly way
Creating analytical capabilities, exploring and extracting knowledge from data.


Qualifications


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience with Data visualization tool (preferably Power BI and/or Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.


Additional Information


The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets, we are leaders and we invest in innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast-growing business.

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

BNPP Personal Finance is, by nature, exposed to Fraud, and relies heavily on quantitative models and strong analytics to manage it. Each day, millions of credit granting decisions are made, using hundreds of decision rules and models. The importance and complexity of these ecosystems at use within BNPP-PF keep on rising as the digital transformation accelerates.

In practice, your day-to-day


Credit Process Optimization team has been created in 2018 within Risk Personal Finance Global Credit Decision-making Policies, in Risk corporate teams. During first years, the team has realized numerous optimization projects, both on Fraud & Risk topics, and, capitalizing on them, has developed a first set of analytical modules to speed-up these projects locally.
This position is dedicated to support Germany‚Äôs local risk team by optimizing the fraud decision processes through an analytical approach. Responsibilities include analyzing fraud patterns, developing, and implementing measures to mitigate fraud and coordinating projects with both local and central stakeholders during the implementation of the new IT system. The main activities will be:
Contribute to the identification of optimization levers on risk & fraud decision process
Support the formalization and further development of effective strategies to manage and prevent fraud
Develop and optimize analyses and reports used to support management decisions
Define and modify necessary data sources and reports in collaboration with internal and external providers
Follow Risk & Fraud rules efficiency and find ways of optimizations through analytical methods and using our internal set of modules dedicated to optimization topics (RBO Toolkit)
Measure the added-value of each optimization project by the definition and valuation of key performance indicators
Provide contents for trainings to partners and employees
Maintain and optimize anti-fraud tools. Monitor their performance and prepare proposals to increase their effectiveness and efficiency
Advise internal stakeholders on fraud topics
Support communications departments in the procurement of contents that support internal and external partners in detecting and preventing fraud

The Mission is important, but working environment is also important!


Within BNP Paribas Personal Finance Central Risk Department is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments. You will operate in a friendly and international work environment, designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible!
You will have regular exchanges with the Central (this will help to build up competence based on different cultures and levels of responsibility).
You will participate to projects and strategics activities, part of the Strategic Plan of BNPP PF.


What do we have to offer you?


The team is evolving in a strategic and challenging environment within Personal Finance and has interactions with different central and local directions. Working in an international environment, the Fraud Credit Process Optimization Data analyst develops his/her knowledge on local specificities: products, market, risk, ...


Are you the one we are looking for?


Have you a few experiences in Credit Risk Management, ideally in Fraud, with mathematical/statistical background and a few years of successful experience, preference in a Bank, a financial environment, or a digital business?
Have you monitored and analysed risk trends and/or fraud trends on applications and/or card payments and detect ways of optimization?
Are you able to work on several projects at the same time and are known for your rigor?
Are you comfortable communicating orally and in writing with different interlocutors and sharing information?
Are you doing everything you can to achieve your goals?
Do you know Python or other database language (SAS, SQL)?
Do you have a good knowledge in Excel and Power point?
Do you have important analytics & business skills as:
Applied Math and Algorithms
Data Processing, Data Knowledge
Descriptive Modelling and Predictive Modelling
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Analytical Ability
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Ability to Synthetise/Simplify
Do you speak English? German is a plus.
If you have all this, a lot of desire, energy, and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for ‚Ä¶
We look forward to your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more
